description: Claude Calame, Poetic and Performative Memory in Ancient Greece: Heroic Reference and Ritual Gestures in Time and Space Foreword Translator's Preface I. Spatio-temporal Poetics of the Past in Ancient Greece II. The Succession of Ages and Poetic Pragmatics of Justice: Hesiod’s Narrative of the Five Human Species III. Creation of Gender and Heroic Identity between Legend and Cult: The Political Creation Of Theseus By Bacchylides IV. Regimes of Historicity and Oracular Logic: How To Re-Found A Colonial City? V. Ritual and Initiatory Itineraries toward the Afterlife: Time, Space, and Pragmatics in the Gold Lamellae By Way of Conclusion: Returns to the Present Bibliography. Image Credits.
title: New Online from the CHS: Claude Calame, Poetic and Performative Memory in Ancient Greece: Heroic Reference and Ritual Gestures in Time and Space
